content: The history of animations and cartoons: In markdown format, create an outline covering major milestones in the development of animation and cartoons, from early forms to present-day techniques.

# The History of Animations and Cartoons

## Introduction
- Definition of animation and cartoons
- Importance in visual media and culture

## Early Beginnings
- Predecessors to animation: shadow plays, magic lanterns
- Phenakistoscope (1832)
- Zoetrope (1834)
- Praxinoscope (1877)

## Birth of Film Animation
- Émile Cohl's "Fantasmagorie" (1908)
- Gertie the Dinosaur (1914) by Winsor McCay
- Felix the Cat (1919)

## Golden Age of American Animation
- Walt Disney and Steamboat Willie (1928)
- Introduction of synchronized sound
- Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (1937) - first full-length animated feature

## Post-World War II Era
- Rise of television and animated series
- Hanna-Barbera Productions: Huckleberry Hound, The Flintstones
- UPA and limited animation technique

## Anime and Manga Influence
- Osamu Tezuka and Astro Boy (1963)
- Studio Ghibli and Hayao Miyazaki
- Global popularity and influence on Western animation

## Computer Animation Revolution
- Pixar and Toy Story (1995)
- Advancements in 3D animation software
- Integration of CGI in live-action films

## Contemporary Animation
- Streaming platforms and original content
- Diversification of genres and target audiences
- Independent and experimental animation

## Conclusion
- Evolution from simple moving images to complex narratives
- Continued innovation and global impact

## References
- List of books, documentaries, and online resources for further reading
